articles.title: As governments across Asia fight for control over the internet and big tech, citizens on social media face rising online crackdowns - ABC News
articles.description: A Facebook post made blogger Bui Van Thuan the latest target of Vietnam's tightening grip on the internet, as online censorship across Asia alarms human rights groups.
articles.content: During the COVID-19 lockdowns in Vietnam last year, blogger Bui Van Thuan took to Facebook to criticise a government plan to use soldiers to deliver groceries to people confined to their homes in Ho … [+6622 chars]

articles.title: Not Only South China Sea, NASA Says Beijing Could Claim Ownership Of Moon If It Wins The New ‘Space Race’ - EurAsian Times
articles.description: China and the United States are engaged in a new space race, according to NASA's top administrator, who warned that if China prevails, it might declare that it owns large portions of the moon.
articles.content:
According to NASA’s top administrator, China and the United States are engaged in a new space race. He warned that if China prevails, it may claim ownership of territory on the moon.

articles.title: Can you get diabetes from eating too much sugar? - Lifestyle Asia Hong Kong
articles.description: Sugar alone doesn’t cause diabetes. However, it does have an indirect effect on insulin resistance or diabetes.
articles.content: Eating too much sugar doesn’t directly cause diabetes. However, there is a correlation (association) between being overweight or having obesity and type 2 diabetes. Over time, consuming too many food… [+13713 chars]
